purpose: The code appears to collect system information such as MAC addresses, hostname, and user info, then send this data to remote servers via HTTP requests.
flows: MAC addresses from os.networkInterfaces() -> macAddresses array -> macString -> base64 encoding
Hostname from os.hostname() -> trackingData -> HTTP request
User info from os.userInfo() -> trackingData -> HTTP request
anomalies: Use of hardcoded domain names that appear to be part of a C2 infrastructure ('oast.fun', 'oast-cn.byted-dast.com')
Sending system information (MAC addresses, hostname, username) to external domains
Sending data to multiple domains suggesting possible command and control behavior
analysis: This code performs several suspicious activities including collecting system fingerprinting data (MAC addresses, hostname, user info) and transmitting it to external domains. The presence of hardcoded domains associated with security testing services (oast.fun, oast-cn.byted-dast.com) combined with disabling SSL verification suggests this may be attempting to exfiltrate data or establish command and control communication.
conclusion: This code exhibits characteristics of malicious behavior by collecting system information and sending it to external domains without proper authorization or encryption.
